comment.author: 47770417@N03
comment._content:
I wonder if this is the nude model that was in so many photos around the turn of the century? She is very famous, but as far as I know, nobody knows who she is. I always thought solving her identity would be a fabulous project for forensic investigators and artists. I wish History Channel or someone else would take up that cause.

Photos of her were not pornographic. They were tasteful and artful. She had light eyes and baby teeth.This looks a lot like her to me. 

Does anyone else know the person I am speaking of? Photos of her are widely distributed. She was very pretty. I would love to know if this is her.

I painted a picture based on one of her photos. I usually recognize her. But the "baby teeth" effect might be from somebody altering her teeth. It looks like someone tried to darken her lip line. Too bad the photo has been messed with.

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Wow, if you look at the larger size it seems the whole dress might be painted on--possibly the headgear too, although maybe that's just been altered.

comment.author: 37408767@N03
comment._content:
Often pictures were tainted or coloured for postcards. This is perhaps such kind of painting ? Same thing for teeth.
Interesting picture.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Tres bien, J.-C. Curtet. I think you have identified this lovely creature correctly.  The caption from the old postcard reads: Germaine Lauret (L'Europeen).  We will add the correct information to the record the next time we update it.  If only we knew more about her....
